html:
AtomicOS

A security-first operating system built from scratch with real memory protection, cryptography, and a deterministic programming language.

ğŸ¯ Overview

AtomicOS is an educational operating system that prioritizes security over performance. Unlike many hobby OS projects, it implements real security features including AES-128 encryption, SHA-256 hashing, and a complete Memory Management Unit (MMU).

Philosophy: "Seguridad primero, luego estabilidad y luego performance" (Security first, then stability, then performance)

âœ¨ Features

Core Kernel (v0.4)

  • âœ… Custom bootloader (Multiboot compliant)
  • âœ… Protected mode with stack protection
  • âœ… Memory Management Unit (MMU) with 2-level paging
  • âœ… Physical and virtual memory management
  • âœ… VGA text mode with color support

Security Features

  • âœ… Real AES-128 encryption (not XOR!)
  • âœ… SHA-256 cryptographic hashing
  • âœ… Memory guards and bounds checking
  • âœ… W^X (Write XOR Execute) enforcement
  • âœ… Secure memory wiping on free
  • âœ… Page-level access control

Tempo Programming Language

  • âœ… Deterministic execution
  • âœ… Worst-Case Execution Time (WCET) analysis
  • âœ… Compiles to x86 assembly
  • âœ… Integrated runtime in kernel

ğŸš€ Quick Start

Prerequisites

  • i686-elf-gcc (cross-compiler for x86)
  • nasm (Netwide Assembler)
  • qemu-system-i386 (for testing)
  • make

Building

# Build AtomicOS v0.4 with MMU
make -f Makefile.v4

# Run in QEMU
./run_mmu.sh

Other Versions

# v0.3 - Security-first design
make -f Makefile.v3
./run_atomicos.sh

# Simple visual demo
make -f Makefile.demo
./ver_demo.sh

ğŸ“ Project Structure

AtomicOS/
â”œâ”€â”€ kernel/
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ kernel_v4_mmu.c    # Latest kernel with MMU
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ mmu.c              # Memory Management Unit
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ crypto_real.c      # AES-128 & SHA-256
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ boot.asm           # Bootloader
â”‚   â””â”€â”€ ...
â”œâ”€â”€ tempo/
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ tempo_compiler.c   # Tempo language compiler
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ LANGUAGE_SPEC.md   # Language specification
â”‚   â””â”€â”€ examples/
â””â”€â”€ docs/
    â”œâ”€â”€ REALITY_CHECK.md   # Honest assessment
    â””â”€â”€ EVIDENCE_*.md      # Test results

ğŸ”¬ Technical Details

Memory Layout

0x00000000 - 0x003FFFFF : Kernel Space (4MB)
0x00400000 - 0xBFFFFFFF : User Space
0xC0000000 - 0xFFFFFFFF : Kernel Mirror (Higher Half)

Security Implementation

  • AES-128: Full implementation with S-boxes, MixColumns, and key scheduling
  • SHA-256: Complete with 64 rounds and proper constants
  • MMU: Hardware-enforced memory protection via page tables

âš ï¸ Important Notice

This is an educational project. While it implements real security concepts, it is NOT production-ready:

  • No network stack
  • No file system
  • No device drivers (except basic VGA)
  • Single-threaded execution
  • Limited error handling

ğŸ“„ License

MIT License with attribution requirements. See LICENSE file.

Key points:

  • âœ… Open source - you can use, modify, and distribute
  • âœ… Attribution required - must credit original project
  • âœ… Name protection - forks must use different name
  • âœ… Change disclosure - modifications must be documented

ğŸ¤ Contributing

Contributions welcome! Please:

  1. Fork the repository
  2. Create a feature branch
  3. Document your changes
  4. Submit a pull request

ğŸ“š Documentation

  • Language Specification - Tempo language details
  • Reality Check - Honest assessment of capabilities
  • Test Evidence - Proof of functionality

ğŸ† Credits

Original Author: Ignacio PeÃ±a Created: 2024

"No exploits, no crashes, no lies." - AtomicOS motto
